stem: Delayed neutrons are fission neutrons that...

choices.A: are released at the instant of fission.
choices.B: are responsible for the majority of U-235 fissions.
choices.C: have reached thermal equilibrium with the surrounding medium.
choices.D: are expelled at a lower average kinetic energy than most other fission neutrons.

stem: Delayed neutrons are neutrons that... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: are responsible for the majority of U-235 fissions.
choices.B: are expelled within 1.0 x 10-14 seconds of the fission event.
choices.C: have reached thermal equilibrium with the surrounding medium.
choices.D: are produced from the radioactive decay of certain fission fragments. -656- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following is a characteristic of a prompt neutron?

choices.A: Expelled with an average kinetic energy of 0.5 MeV.
choices.B: Usually emitted by the excited nucleus of a fission product.
choices.C: Accounts for more than 99 percent of fission neutrons.
choices.D: Released an average of 13 seconds after the fission event.

stem: A neutron that is expelled 1.0 x 10-2 seconds after the associated fission event is a __________ neutron. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: thermal
choices.B: delayed
choices.C: prompt
choices.D: capture -657- PWR Test Items

stem: A neutron that is expelled 1.0 x 10-6 seconds after the associated fission event is a __________ neutron.

choices.A: thermal
choices.B: prompt
choices.C: delayed
choices.D: capture

stem: Which one of the following types of neutrons has an average neutron generation lifetime of 12.5 seconds? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Prompt
choices.B: Delayed
choices.C: Fast
choices.D: Thermal -658- PWR Test Items

stem: In a comparison between a delayed neutron and a prompt neutron produced from the same fission event, the prompt neutron is more likely to... (Assume that both neutrons remain in the core.)

choices.A: require a greater number of collisions to become a thermal neutron.
choices.B: be captured by U-238 at a resonance energy peak between 1 eV and 1000 eV.
choices.C: be expelled with a lower kinetic energy.
choices.D: cause thermal fission of a U-235 nucleus.

stem: In a comparison between a delayed neutron and a prompt neutron produced from the same fission event, the prompt neutron is more likely to... (Assume that both neutrons remain in the core.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: cause fast fission of a U-238 nucleus.
choices.B: be captured by a U-238 nucleus at a resonance energy between 1 eV and 1000 eV.
choices.C: be captured by a Xe-135 nucleus.
choices.D: cause thermal fission of a U-235 nucleus. -659- PWR Test Items

stem: A neutron that is released 1.0 x 10-10 seconds after the associated fission event is classified as a __________ fission neutron.

choices.A: delayed
choices.B: prompt
choices.C: thermal
choices.D: spontaneous

stem: In a comparison between a prompt neutron and a delayed neutron produced from the same fission event, the delayed neutron requires __________ collisions in the moderator to become thermal; and is __________ likely to cause fission of a U-238 nucleus. (Assume that both neutrons remain in the core.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: more; more
choices.B: more; less
choices.C: fewer; more
choices.D: fewer; less -660- PWR Test Items

stem: In a comparison between a delayed neutron and a prompt neutron produced from the same fission event, the prompt neutron is more likely to...

choices.A: be captured by a Xe-135 nucleus.
choices.B: cause thermal fission of a U-235 nucleus.
choices.C: leak out of the core while slowing down.
choices.D: be captured by a U-238 nucleus at a resonance energy.

stem: In a comparison between a delayed neutron and a prompt neutron produced from the same fission event, the delayed neutron is more likely to... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: leak out of the core.
choices.B: cause fission of a U-238 nucleus.
choices.C: become a thermal neutron.
choices.D: cause fission of a Pu-240 nucleus. -661- PWR Test Items

stem: During a brief time interval in a typical reactor operating steady-state near the beginning of a fuel cycle, 1.0 x 103 delayed neutrons were emitted. Approximately how many prompt neutrons were emitted during this same time interval?

Which one of the following types of neutrons in a reactor is more likely to cause fission of a U-238 nucleus in the reactor fuel? (Assume that each type of neutron remains in the reactor until it interacts with a U-238 nucleus.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: A thermal neutron.
choices.B: A prompt fission neutron beginning to slow down.
choices.C: A delayed fission neutron beginning to slow down.
choices.D: A fission neutron at a U-238 resonance energy. -662- PWR Test Items

stem: A neutron that appears 1.0 x 10-16 seconds after the associated fission event is classified as a __________ fission neutron. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: delayed
choices.B: prompt
choices.C: thermal
choices.D: spontaneous -663- PWR Test Items

stem: In a comparison between a delayed neutron and a prompt neutron produced from the same fission event, the delayed neutron is more likely to... (Assume that each neutron remains in the core unless otherwise stated.)

choices.A: cause fission of a U-238 nucleus.
choices.B: travel to an adjacent fuel assembly.
choices.C: be absorbed in a B-10 nucleus.
choices.D: leak out of the core.

stem: Which one of the following is the process that produces the majority of delayed neutrons in an operating nuclear power plant reactor? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: A thermal neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. After a period of time, the nucleus fissions and releases a delayed neutron.
choices.B: A thermal neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. The fuel nucleus fissions. During the decay process of the fission products, a delayed neutron is emitted.
choices.C: A fast neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. After a period of time, the nucleus fissions and releases a delayed neutron.
choices.D: A fast neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. The fuel nucleus fissions. During the decay process of the fission products, a delayed neutron is emitted. -664- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following is the process that produces the majority of prompt neutrons in an operating nuclear power plant reactor?

choices.A: A thermal neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. Almost immediately, the nucleus fissions and emits one or more prompt neutrons.
choices.B: A thermal neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. Almost immediately, the fuel nucleus fissions and produces fission products. During the decay of the fission products, one or more prompt neutrons are emitted.
choices.C: A fast neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. Almost immediately, the nucleus fissions and emits one or more prompt neutrons.
choices.D: A fast neutron is absorbed by a fuel nucleus. Almost immediately, the fuel nucleus fissions and produces fission products. During the decay of the fission products, one or more prompt neutrons are emitted.

stem: Which one of the following nuclei will cause the greater loss of kinetic energy from a 2.1 MeV fission neutron during a head-on collision? (Assume that each nucleus is stationary just prior to the collision and the neutron is elastically scattered in all cases.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: A helium-4 nucleus in the fuel rod fill gas.
choices.B: An oxygen-16 nucleus in the reactor coolant.
choices.C: A zirconium-90 nucleus in the fuel cladding.
choices.D: A uranium-235 nucleus in a fuel pellet. -665- PWR Test Items

stem: Delayed neutrons are fission neutrons that... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: have an average lifetime of about 80 seconds.
choices.B: have an average kinetic energy of about 2 MeV.
choices.C: are responsible for less than one percent of all fissions.
choices.D: are in thermal equilibrium with the surrounding medium. -666- PWR Test Items
